Example of SIRS model generated from the pomp package.

Source: R/data.R
sirs_data.Rd

This is a deterministic SIRS model where the infection parameter \(\beta = 0.2\) and the recovery from infection parameter is parameter is \(\gamma = 0.1\). The recovery to susceptible parameter is \(\eta = .05\). The initial number of susceptible is \(S(0) = 990\) and the initial number of infectious is \(I(0)=10\). There are 100 steps. So in summary, \(S^\prime = -\beta SI / N + \eta R\), \(I^\prime = \beta S I /N -\gamma I\) and \(R^\prime = \gamma I - \eta R\).

sirs_data

Format

The object is a data frame.

Examples

library(ggplot2)
library(tidyr)
#> 
#> Attaching package: ‘tidyr’
#> The following object is masked from ‘package:testthat’:
#> 
#>     matches
head(sirs_data)
#>          S        I        R time .id
#> 1 990.0000 10.00000 0.000000    0   1
#> 2 987.9475 11.02739 1.025153    1   1
#> 3 985.7395 12.15516 2.105390    2   1
#> 4 983.3596 13.39212 3.248242    3   1
#> 5 980.7906 14.74767 4.461765    4   1
#> 6 978.0137 16.23175 5.754562    5   1
if(EpiCompare:::tidyr_new_interface()){
  ggplot(data = sirs_data %>%
         tidyr::pivot_longer(-c(time, .id)),
          aes(x = time, y = value, group = name, col = name)) + geom_line()
} else {
  ggplot(data = sirs_data %>%
         tidyr::gather("name", "value", -time, -.id),
          aes(x = time, y = value, group = name, col = name)) + geom_line()
}
